snippet: The appeals court ruling overturning the convictions of two hedge fund managers went too far in narrowing the parameters of insider trading, contends Michael Perino.
abstract: The appeals court ruling overturning the convictions of two hedge fund managers went too far in narrowing the parameters of insider trading, contends Michael Perino.
lead_paragraph: Michael Perino is a professor at St. John’s University School of Law and the author of “The Hellhound of Wall Street: How Ferdinand Pecora’s Investigation of the Great Crash Forever Changed American Finance.”
